bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Currier McEwen, January 16, 1953

div1.p: Hench is sending McEwen a report on the Camp Lazear dedication. Hench placed the wreath from Bellevue Medical Center in honor of Reed and would appreciate reimbursement. He can send a photograph if desired.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Currier McEwen, January 16, 1953
div1.opener:
January 16, 1953
Dr. Currier McEwen
Dean of the Medical School
Bellevue Medical Center
New York University
477 First Avenue
New York, New York
My dear Currier:
div1.p:
Enclosed you will find my personal report regarding the dedication of
Camp Lazear. The floral tributes were beautiful and very well received
by the Cubans. Your representative, Dr. Emilio Jane (by the way it is
spelled Jane, not Jayne) was ill and since he could not attend the cere-
mony I substituted for him, placing your wreath in honor of Major Reed.
Incidentally, your wreath in Reed's honor was the first one of the three
placed in his honor. (See memorandum page 9) I do hope that you can visit
Camp Lazear some time.

The cost of each wreath was $15. They were really very lovely and would
have cost two or three times that much here. They were purchased from
Milagros Flores, Lucila Schumann, President, who only gave me one bill
itemizing each wreath and institutional donor. If you need an ozalid copy
I can send it. Otherwise I should be glad to receive a check for $15 at
your convenience.

Should you wish, for any purpose, a photograph of me placing the wreath
in behalf of Bellevue Medical College, professional photographers took a
special photograph and Doctor Nogueira is going to lend the films to me
shortly. I can either send you a small print at essentially no cost - just
a few cents, or if you want, I can have a local photographer enlarge one
for I suppose the usual price of around a dollar.

It may be that your Medical Library will wish to keep the enclosed clip-
pings with the memorandum. That will be fine. If, however, the clippings
are to be thrown away at any time. I should be glad to have them back but
I did get them for you.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
